trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control.

In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface.
When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.

The properties of the DetailsViewDesigner class provide the following functionality: - The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property returns a collection of formatting schemes for display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control and the top level <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> templates.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control to generate the design-time markup.

The DetailsViewDesigner class methods provide the following functionality: - The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.DataBind%2A> method binds the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control to a design-time data source.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.OnClick%2A> method is called when a region of the design-time view of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> is clicked.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.OnSchemaRefreshed%2A> method is called when the schema of the data source of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> changes.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to remove or add additional properties or to shadow properties of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>.

Design-time editable regions are not supported in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control, so the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> methods have no functionality.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.
Gets the designer action list collection for this designer.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> associated with this designer.
Gets the collection of automatic formatting schemes to display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> is populated from an XML-encoded member of an internal class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection"></xref> that contains the predefined schemes for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref>.
Binds the associated control to the design-time data source.

The DataBind method binds the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control to the design-time data source and calculates the number of pager and automatically generated rows that are required, based on features that are specified for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>.
The `dataBoundControl` parameter represents the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control that is associated with this designer, or a copy of that control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control to bind to the design-time data source.
Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.

First, the GetDesignTimeHtml method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.AutoGenerateRows%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control to `true`, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Fields%2A> collection is empty.

The GetDesignTimeHtml then sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.DataKeyNames%2A> collection of the GetDesignTimeHtml control to an empty <xref:System.String> array if the schema of the data source cannot be obtained.
It refreshes the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object to force the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method to be called.
It then calls the base method to generate the markup.
A <xref:System.String> containing the markup used to render the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> at design time.
Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time and populates a collection of designer regions.

The GetDesignTimeHtml method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to generate the markup for the design-time rendering of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.
The GetDesignTimeHtml method also populates `regions` with a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> object for each clickable or selectable region of the design-time rendering.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>, the first cell in each row is selectable; all the cells in the rows are clickable.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> to which to add definitions of the selectable and clickable regions in the design-time view of the control.
A <xref:System.String> containing the markup used to render the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> at design time.
Returns the content for an editable region of the design-time view of the associated control.
This functionality is not currently available.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> for which to fetch content.
The content for an editable region of the design-time view of the associated control.
Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.
The designer host calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.
The Initialize and its base methods configure properties and set up events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter represents the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of that control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref>, control which implements an <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref>.
Called when a region of the design-time view for the associated control is clicked.
The OnClick method saves the selected region index and updates the markup that renders the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control on the design surface.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs"></xref> that defines the clicked region of the control.
Called when the schema of the data source for the associated control changes.

Unless the designer is in template editing mode or a field is being added or edited, the OnSchemaRefreshed method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InvokeTransactedChange%2A> method, which in turn calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> method to update the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control to reflect the data source change.
Used by the designer to remove properties from or add properties to the display in the Properties grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

Control designers use methods derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the `Properties` grid.

For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control, the PreFilterProperties method sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute> object of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Fields%2A> property to `false` when the control is in template mode.
This ensures that a column that is in template mode cannot be deleted using the `Fields` dialog box.
A collection implementing the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> of the added and shadowed properties.
Gets the number of sample rows for the associated control to display.
The SampleRowCount property always returns the number `2`.
This causes two page links to be displayed in the pager row of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control at design time.
The number of sample rows to show.
Specifies content for an editable region of the design-time view of the associated control.
The SetEditableDesignerRegionContent method has no functionality; there is no support for editable regions in the design-time view of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> to update.
A <xref:System.String> to write to `region`.
Gets a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated control.

The TemplateGroups property constructs a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> objects, one for each templated data field and one for each control field (such as header, footer, and pager) in the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.
The data field <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> elements have a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition> object for each of the predefined row template types.
The control field <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> elements contain a single <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition>.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection"></xref> containing an element for each templated field in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control.
Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy, rather than the actual control associated with the designer, to generate the design-time markup.

Because the UsePreviewControl property is always `true`, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control to generate the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>.

If the UsePreviewControl property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer will use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control itself to generate the design-time markup.
Always <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
